User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 5.1; rv:5.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/5.0
Build ID: 20110615151330

Steps to reproduce:

When I stopped viewing mail messages (in subfolders of "Local Folders") and started reading Usenet newsgroups, a popup appeared on the screen asking whether I'd like to compact the mail folders now.  I answered Yes.


Actual results:

Both the message pane and the list-of-messages pane disappeared from the screen and were replaced by a blank area with a few buttons on it, as if I had changed focus from the newsgroup I was reading to one of the top-level account folders.


Expected results:

The newsgroup message I was reading, and the list of messages, should have stayed right where they were.
comments.author: jdg@diogenes.sacramento.ca.us

comments.raw_text:
Yes, I have retention set to forever for the newsgroups server.  I also have it download everything for offline use.

I never delete newsgroup messages (filters use "mark as read" instead), so I never get a prompt to compact a newsgroup folder.  However, when I compact (usually triggered by messages in subfolders of Local Folders that have passed their retention date), Thunderbird compacts (or at least behaves as though it is compacting) ALL folders, including newsgroups and others that have retention set to forever.  If Thunderbird's "compact folders" logic were smart enough not to clear the screen of data it isn't going to affect, this bug would not have been necessary.
